dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.
dependencies.name: libx11

dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.
dependencies.name: libxext

dependencies.description: libXrender - library for the Render Extension to the X11 protocol.
dependencies.name: libxrender

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

dependencies.description:
X Resize and Rotate Extension (RandR). This extension defines a protocol
for clients to dynamically change X screens, so as to resize, rotate and
reflect the root window of a screen.
dependencies.name: randrproto

dependencies.description:
X Rendering Extension. This extension defines the protcol for a digital
image composition as the foundation of a new rendering model within the
X Window System.
dependencies.name: renderproto

dependencies.description:
This is a set of autoconf macros used by the configure.ac scripts in
other Xorg modular packages, and is needed to generate new versions of
their configure scripts with autoconf.
dependencies.name: util-macros

dependent_to.description:
compiz - OpenGL window and compositing manager. Compiz is an OpenGL
compositing manager that use GLX_EXT_texture_from_pixmap for binding
redirected top-level windows to texture objects. It has a flexible plug-
in system and it is designed to run well on most graphics hardware.
dependent_to.name: compiz

dependent_to.description:
This is a tool to cheat an X11 server to believe that there are more
monitors than there actually are.
dependent_to.name: fakexrandr

dependent_to.description:
FOX is a C++ based Toolkit for developing Graphical User Interfaces
easily and effectively. It offers a wide, and growing, collection of
Controls, and provides state of the art facilities such as drag and
drop, selection, as well as OpenGL widgets for 3D graphical
manipulation. FOX also implements icons, images, and user-convenience
features such as status line help, and tooltips. Tooltips may even be
used for 3D objects!
dependent_to.name: fox

dependent_to.description:
GLFW is an Open Source, multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES and
Vulkan development on the desktop. It provides a simple API for creating
windows, contexts and surfaces, receiving input and events.
dependent_to.name: glfw

dependent_to.description:
libcanberra is an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name
Specifications, for generating event sounds on free desktops, such as
GNOME.
dependent_to.name: libcanberra

dependent_to.description:
This package contains header files and documentation for the Present
extension. Library and server implementations are separate.
dependent_to.name: libxpresent

dependent_to.description:
OpenSceneGraph is an open source, high performance 3D graphics toolkit
that's used in a variety of visual simulation applications.
dependent_to.name: openscenegraph

dependent_to.description:
OpenSubdiv is a set of open source libraries that implement high
performance subdivision surface (subdiv) evaluation on massively
parallel CPU and GPU architectures. This code path is optimized for
drawing deforming surfaces with static topology at interactive
framerates.
dependent_to.name: opensubdiv

dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.
dependent_to.name: qt

dependent_to.description:
setxkbmap is an X11 client to change the keymaps in the X server for a
specified keyboard to use the layout determined by the options listed on
the command line.
dependent_to.name: setxkbmap

dependent_to.description:
xev creates a window and then asks the X server to send it X11 events
whenever anything happens to the window (such as it being moved,
resized, typed in, clicked in, etc.). You can also attach it to an
existing window. It is useful for seeing what causes events to occur and
to display the information that they contain; it is essentially a
debugging and development tool, and should not be needed in normal
usage.
dependent_to.name: xev

dependent_to.description:
Daemon, manager, and editor to centralize the configuration management
for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-settings

dependent_to.description: xinput is a utility to configure and test XInput devices.
dependent_to.name: xinput

dependent_to.description:
xrandr - primitive command line interface to X11 Resize, Rotate, and
Reflect (RandR) extension.
dependent_to.name: xrandr

description: libXrandr - X Resize, Rotate and Reflection extension library.
name: libxrandr

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
